result.execSummary:
The defendant Jody Ann Degen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jody Ann Degen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jody Ann Degen was found guilty of Lewd, Lascivious Behavior-Exposure [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.20(1)(b).
  • Jody Ann Degen was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CO: Vlack, DAR, Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Michael E. Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Jody Ann Degen appeared. Case called at 10:05 pm. ADA Nieskes makes statement. There is an agreement. No objection from Atty Caton. Court reviews constitutional rights with def. Court finds Def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for count #4 and #5, Def pleads Guilty. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates def guilty of count #4 and #5. Counts #1, #2, #3 and #6 are dismissed. 
Court orders:
- Court Costs; Apply Bond
- DNA Sample and Surcharge
- Restitution to be determined
-  2 days Jail, time served (credit for 2 days)
- 30 Days Jail STAYED
- Letter to Apology to the owner of the campground
If Letter is not written in 6 months court will issue warrant. km  Review scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 07:55 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Deputy Kennett.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: EFV, RPT: Elizabeth Frank, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  Joseph Caton,  DF:  Jody Ann Degen appeared from jail.  Defendant does qualify for PD.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Waive speedy prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.
